title: Packers‚Äô Christian Watson provides Jordan Love update while QB can‚Äôt talk
description: Christian Watson shares a promising update on Jordan Love as the Packers QB remains in concussion protocol ahead of Ravens matchup.
fullText:
Packers‚Äô Christian Watson provides Jordan Love update while QB can‚Äôt talk appeared first on ClutchPoints. 

The Green Bay Packers are preparing for a high-powered Saturday night matchup against the Baltimore Ravens, but much of the focus this week has centered on quarterback Jordan Love‚Äôs availability.

Love remains in the NFL‚Äôs concussion protocol following a hard hit in last week‚Äôs 22-16 loss to the Chicago Bears, which means he is not allowed to speak publicly. In his absence, teammates have helped fill in the picture of where things stand.

Wide receiver Christian Watson offered the clearest update after Wednesday‚Äôs practice, sharing optimism about Love‚Äôs progress while also acknowledging the uncertainty that comes with the league‚Äôs strict return-to-play rules.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs looked really good,‚Äù Watson said via The Athletic. ‚ÄúFrom everything that I‚Äôve talked to him about, he feels like he‚Äôs in a good spot. Obviously, he‚Äôs gotta clear everything. I think he‚Äôs just approaching it like a normal week in terms of how he‚Äôs going about everything, and then, obviously, he‚Äôll just let the medical staff take care of the rest..He‚Äôs looked like J-Love out there, so, obviously, if he does get the opportunity to play on Saturday, I know he‚Äôll be ready to go.‚Äù

Love suffered the injury in the second quarter against Chicago after a helmet-to-helmet collision with Bears defensive end Austin Booker. Although he was able to leave the field under his own power, he did not return and was later placed in concussion protocol, immediately casting doubt on his Week 17 status.

Encouragingly for Green Bay, Love was a limited participant in Wednesday‚Äôs practice. During the portion open to reporters, he reportedly appeared to take his normal workload, and completing passes. These observations, combined with Watson‚Äôs comments, suggest Love is progressing as expected.

Still, nothing is guaranteed. NFL concussion protocol prohibits media access to players until they are fully cleared, and head coach Matt LaFleur has admitted even he doesn‚Äôt have every step of the process memorized. Love must pass a series of evaluations before being allowed back on the field.

For the Packers, who are chasing a playoff berth, the coming days will be very critical. If Love continues trending upward and earns medical clearance, Green Bay could enter Saturday night with renewed confidence.

If not, the team will need to adjust quickly ‚Äî but either way, the situation underscores how much hinges on Love‚Äôs health as the postseason push intensifies.

title: Christmas Game Preview ‚Äì Timberwolves at Nuggets
description: Minnesota Timberwolves at Denver NuggetsDate: December 25th, 2025Time: 9:30 PM CSTLocation: Ball ArenaTelevision Coverage: ABC, ESPNRadio Coverage: Wolves App, iHeart Radio The Minnesota Timberwolves delivered some early holiday cheer to the Target Center crowd on Tuesday evening, notching their first victory over Karl-Anthony Towns since the legendary fall-2024 trade. Yes, it came against a Knicks [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Minnesota Timberwolves at Denver Nuggets
Date: December 25th, 2025
Time: 9:30 PM CST
Location: Ball Arena
Television Coverage: ABC, ESPN
Radio Coverage: Wolves App, iHeart Radio

The Minnesota Timberwolves delivered some early holiday cheer to the Target Center crowd on Tuesday evening, notching their first victory over Karl-Anthony Towns since the legendary fall-2024 trade. Yes, it came against a Knicks team missing Jalen Brunson, OG Anunoby, and half their rotation. And yes, it was a little surreal watching KAT torch his old team for 40 points while Wolves fans were forced to clap politely through clenched teeth. But context aside, the Wolves took care of business, beat a +.500 team, and continued to quietly stack real wins.

It wasn‚Äôt clean, because, let‚Äôs face it, it‚Äôs never clean with this team. Minnesota built a comfortable lead, then immediately got comfortable. New York ripped off two 10-0 runs as well as a 17-3 run during the course of the game. During the third quarter the game felt like it might slip away‚Ä¶ until Anthony Edwards woke up and decided he wasn‚Äôt interested in that storyline. Ant matched KAT nearly bucket for bucket, finishing with 38, and then Julius Randle finally arrived in the fourth quarter like the cavalry, pouring in 17 points, including 15 straight Wolves points at one stretch. On a night when Towns was missing his co-star, Minnesota‚Äôs own duo, Edwards and Randle, closed the door.

That win capped off something much bigger: the Wolves have now gone 3-0 in this brutal holiday homestand against the Thunder, Bucks, and Knicks. One game of this Christmas Week gauntlet remains. And it happens to be one of the biggest regular-season games this franchise will play all year.

Christmas Night.
In Denver.
Against Nikola Jokic.

Minnesota‚Äôs surge has vaulted them into fifth place, leapfrogging Houston, with the Lakers barely ahead. A win in Denver puts the Wolves within half a game of the Nuggets for third in the West, which is a stunning place to be considering the chaos of the first 30 games: Ant‚Äôs hamstring injury, multiple blown games, and long stretches where this team looked like it was trying to solve calculus without knowing multiplication.

The Wolves dominated this matchup last season, pulling off a four-game season sweep. But 2025-26 has flipped the script: Denver has already beaten Minnesota twice at Target Center. If the Wolves want to restore balance, they‚Äôll need to do something they‚Äôve proven they can do ‚Äî win in Mile High.

With the entire league watching, the Wolves have a chance to deliver a real contender‚Äôs statement.

Nikola Jokic is the best player on the planet. There is no stopping him. There is only survival.

Minnesota‚Äôs formula remains the same: Rudy Gobert, Naz Reid, and Julius Randle take turns leaning on him, making every touch exhausting, forcing him into facilitator mode, and controlling the glass. Denver added Jonas Valanƒçi≈´nas, giving them more frontcourt depth than last year, so the Wolves‚Äô size advantage only matters if they use it aggressively. Second-chance points cannot tilt this game.

Wear him down. Make him pass. Make the other Nuggets beat you.

When Murray ignites, the Nuggets become terrifying. The Wolves have the personnel to prevent that.

If Jaden McDaniels can go, he‚Äôs the first option. If not, Anthony Edwards and Jaylen Clark must shoulder the responsibility. Murray cannot get comfortable. He cannot get clean looks. He cannot start that rhythmic pull-up nonsense that makes Denver impossible to deal with.

Slow Murray, and the math of this game changes immediately.

The Wolves must play sharp, disciplined basketball: no careless passes, no lazy dribbles into traffic, no self-inflicted wounds that fuel Nuggets runs. Crisp movement, smart decisions, full commitment to winning the possession game.

This is not the night for sloppiness.

After a sluggish stretch, Minnesota‚Äôs shooting finally ticked upward against New York. That momentum must continue.

This only works if the Wolves avoid ISO-ball. Make Denver rotate, use Ant and Randle‚Äôs gravity, find Naz, Donte, Jaden, and Conley in rhythm.

This offense is deadly when it flows.

Edwards and Randle just finished dismantling New York‚Äôs defense in crunch time. They must do it again, together. Not forcing shots. Not hunting hero moments. Just relentlessly attacking, creating, and letting the offense breathe.

Given the plethora of injuries that the Nuggets are dealing with, whichever duo wins this matchup likely wins the game.

This is the game that transforms a hot streak into a statement.
This is the game that tells the West the Wolves are not just back ‚Äî they are for real.

Time to put on the Grinch costume and ruin Denver‚Äôs evening, while giving Timberwolves Nation the gift we‚Äôve all been waiting for.

Brown, a former University of Illinois All-American offensive lineman, was selected by Pittsburgh in the third round of the 2021 NFL draft. He‚Äôs played in 36 career NFL games with Pittsburgh and Houston.

title: Evan Mobley could make another quick return to the Cavaliers lineup amid calf issue
description: Evan Mobley suffered a calf injury earlier in December, but he could possibly play on Christmas day for the Cavaliers.
fullText:
Evan Mobley could make another quick return to the Cavaliers lineup amid calf issue originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Evan Mobley sustained a calf injury a couple of weeks ago, but it looks like he is ready to return. Ahead of the Cleveland Cavaliers' Christmas Day game against the New York Knicks, Mobley is listed as "Questionable", which could mean he might be able to play.

Without Mobley, the Cavaliers lost to the Charlotte Hornets and lost twice against the Chicago Bulls. While the Cavs got payback against the Hornets and blew out the New Orleans Pelicans, they still need a healthy lineup, which is why Mobley's potential return will be significant.

After missing the last five games for the Cavs, Mobley was initially set to miss two to four weeks. Christmas Day will be 13 days since the calf tightness popped up, so Mobley is way ahead of schedule.

While he is listed as questionable, many Cavs fans are a bit uneasy with his quick return. Calf injuries have been a problem in recent years in the NBA because they are the injury that could lead to a torn Achilles tendon.

More:¬†Donovan Mitchell gives credit to Sam Merrill as the Cavaliers offense shines

Across Mobley's career, he has beaten the typical return-to-play timelines. The Inside Shot's Danny Cunningham noted that Mobley is a fast healer, and this potential return from his calf injury is a good example of this.

The Cavaliers are playing against the Knicks on Christmas Day, which will be one of the biggest games of the season. Cleveland and New York were the favorites ahead of the season, but only the latter has met expectations.

With Mobley possibly joining the team on Christmas Day, the Cavaliers could pull off a surprise upset against the second-seeded Knicks. The Cavaliers are sitting in the seventh seed, but they could be a much better team if they start on a huge run by beating the Knicks.

description: SAN ANGELO, Texas (Concho Valley Homepage) ‚Äî Maverick McIvor played for the Central Bobcats from 2016-19. Maverick McIvor, a former Central Bobcat quarterback, delivered Western Kentucky fans an early Christmas gift on Tuesday night. McIvor, who now plays quarterback for the Hilltoppers, came off the bench in the second quarter to lift his team to [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
SAN ANGELO, Texas (Concho Valley Homepage) ‚Äî Maverick McIvor played for the Central Bobcats from 2016-19.

Maverick McIvor, a former Central Bobcat quarterback, delivered Western Kentucky fans an early Christmas gift on Tuesday night. McIvor, who now plays quarterback for the Hilltoppers, came off the bench in the second quarter to lift his team to a comeback victory over Southern Mississippi in the New Orleans Bowl.

McIvor entered the game late in the second quarter, replacing injured starter Rodney Tisdale Jr. The Hilltoppers trailed 13-6 at halftime, but outscored the Golden Eagles 21-3 in the second half en route to a 27-16 win. McIvor hadn‚Äôt played since Oct 14, when he suffered a left shoulder injury. In his return, he completed 12 of 19 pass attempts for 199 passing yards and recorded a rushing touchdown. His heroics earned him the game‚Äôs MVP honor as Western Kentucky finishes its 2025 season with a 9-4 record.

title: Packers‚Äô Adam Stenavich hits offense with blunt reality check
description: Packers offensive coordinator Adam Stenavich speaks up on a troubling issue concerning Green Bay's offense.
fullText:
Packers‚Äô Adam Stenavich hits offense with blunt reality check appeared first on ClutchPoints. 

The Green Bay Packers are on a two-game losing skid, and while their chances to make the NFL playoffs remain favorable, they have some issues to address if they are to make a deep postseason run.

Among which concerns their offense that hasn‚Äôt been up to par of late, especially in one particular area.

Packers offensive coordinator Adam Stenavich touched on that subject while speaking to the media on Wednesday.

‚ÄúIt hasn‚Äôt been good enough. Flat out. We‚Äôve been bad,‚Äù Stenavich said of Green Bay‚Äôs offense in the red zone, via Matt Schneidman of The Athletic.

Over the last two games, the Packers have gone just 1-for-9 on touchdown conversions when inside the opponents‚Äô 20-yard line. In Week 15‚Äôs 34-26 road loss to the Denver Broncos at Empower Field at Mile High in Denver, the Packers scored just one touchdown in four trips to the red zone.

For what it‚Äôs worth, they were 6-for-13 on third downs and 1-for-3 on fourth downs in that contest. In the following game, versus the Chicago Bears at Soldier Field in Chicago, Green Bay missed out on all five of its chances to score a touchdown in the red zone.

Granted that the Packers lost quarterback Jordan Love to injury in the first half of the Bears game, the Packers still could have done better offensively.

The Packers can turn things around in that area this coming Saturday, when they host the Baltimore Ravens at Lambeau Field in Green Bay. However, that could be easier said than done, as the Ravens are sixth-best in the league so far in the 2025 season with a 50.88 percent success rate against touchdown scoring in the red zone.

title: Kawhi Leonard is playing in Terminator mode
description: The Sporting Tribune's BJ Matthews writes that 'The Terminator' is here. No, not Arnold Schwarzenegger, but the other guy that plays basketball for that team in L.A.
fullText:
No, not Arnold Schwarzenegger, but the other guy that plays basketball for that team in LA.

The LA Clippers just came off their best win of the season against the Houston Rockets 128-108. The victory came behind Leonard‚Äôs 41 points, 8 rebounds, and 5 assists and his insane shooting splits of 69/80/100. Despite his performance, much like his character Leonard remains focused on the mission.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a long season, so anytime we put on this jersey, you go to compete and try to win a basketball game. And that‚Äôs what I‚Äôm taking priority in. I think everyone else is too. Leonard said after the game.

KAWHI LEONARD TONIGHT:

41 POINTS
8 REBOUNDS
5 ASSISTS
13/23 FG
4/5 3P

üî•üî•üî• pic.twitter.com/haMQcjRw0b

‚Äî Legion Hoops (@LegionHoops) December 24, 2025

It has been a rough season for the Clippers who are right now 8-21, and are in the 14th seed in the Western conference, but surprisingly there are quite a few things the Clippers should feel encouraged about.

Kawhi Leonard is fully healthy.

Throughout his six year tenure with the Clippers, it seems as if the stigma ‚Äúwhen healthy‚Äù has followed Leonard even when he's perfectly fine. For the season, Leonard is averaging 26.1 ppg, 6.2 rpg, and 2.0 spg. He is tied for his career high in steals per game, as well as his free throw percentage at 97.8% for the season! However his production exceeds the stat sheet.

Much of the time Leonard was on the court, he took the initiative to guard Rockets All-Star Forward Kevin Durant. Not an easy task by any means, but Leonard was up for the challenge.

‚ÄúI mean they got two hall of famer players. Durant said. I think they‚Äôve been playing at an elite level the last few years, so Kawhi and James (Harden) they can win any night. And tonight, they came out and did that.‚Äù

The Rockets did everything they could to try and get Leonard out of rhythm. They switched coverage's, they brought double teams wherever he had the ball, even Rockets Forward Tari Eason tried to get physical with Leonard. It simply wasn‚Äôt enough.

Kawhi Leonard‚Äôs mentality mirrors ‚ÄúThe Terminator‚Äù

Coming into the season, many expected for the Clippers to be a top notch team mainly because of their best player‚Äôs presence. However, due to a combination of injuries, minutes restrictions, and strength of schedule it's been a rough 30 game stretch. However, there is a lot to look forward to with the Clippers still much in the playoff hunt, despite their bad record.

For a long 82 game season, where emotions tend to be up and down surrounding the team it is beneficial to have your best player maintain a level of calmness. The name ‚ÄúThe Terminator‚Äù for Leonard fits like a glove.

title: Cam Johnson and Trey Murphy believe Steph Curry is the most unique player ever
description: Cam Johnson and Trey Murphy III see Stephen Curry as an unbelievable player who cannot be replicated.
fullText:
Cam Johnson and Trey Murphy believe Steph Curry is the most unique player ever originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Stephen Curry is one of this generation's best players, and that is evident in his influence. Nowadays, the league is filled with teams playing a three-point-centric system because Curry pioneered it in the 2010s.

Of course, the three-point shot has been around for decades at that point, but no one ever utilized it as well as the Golden State Warriors and Curry. Now that he is in his late-30s, many people still appreciate how well Curry is playing, including his NBA peers like Cameron Johnson and Trey Murphy III.

Throughout NBA history, there have been many players who have stood out. The likes of Michael Jordan, Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, and Shaquille O'Neal were game-changers. It is not hyperbolic to say that Curry is one of the players who changed the game of basketball.

With his excellence as a three-point shooter, most young players wanted to be like him. They wanted to be as effective as him as a shooter because that is the optimal way to play and win games.

More:¬†Steph Curry trade idea sends Warriors legend home to finish his career

As players who grew up during a time when Curry was breaking out as a superstar, Johnson and Murphy became top players in the high school and college ranks with Curry as an influence. Now that they are veterans in the NBA, they appreciate Curry even more since they have played against him.

"I think it takes a lot for a coach to allow you to do that, right? You know, it just seems unlikely that he's that special as a shooting talent. I don't think that we'll ever see again. To do it at the level Steph does it to win championships, to consistently do it for 15, 16, 17 years, we'll never see it again," Johnson said on The Old Man And The Three with him and Murphy.

Curry continues to be one of the special players in the league today. Many players would want to be as effective as him, but he is still the league's best shooter even when he's in his late 30s. He will retire someday, but he is still playing at an elite level, and other players are still chasing him as the unique superstar.

title: Vikings prep for Lions with Brosmer at QB
description: MINNEAPOLIS (KELO) ‚Äî The Vikings are getting set for their Christmas Day showdown with the division rival Lions. Minnesota has won three straight games after going winless in November. However, the Vikes will be without starting quarterback J.J. McCarthy, who suffered a hairline fracture on his throwing hand in Sunday‚Äôs win at the Giants.
fullText:
MINNEAPOLIS (KELO) ‚Äî The Vikings are getting set for their Christmas Day showdown with the division rival Lions.

Minnesota has won three straight games after going winless in November. However, the Vikes will be without starting quarterback J.J. McCarthy, who suffered a hairline fracture on his throwing hand in Sunday‚Äôs win at the Giants.

Now, they‚Äôll turn to rookie Max Brosmer, who threw four interceptions at Seattle in his most recent action before last Sunday.

‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs really difficult to be in that situation to come out and continue to work and prepare the same way because you look back and like, ‚Äòoh, do I have to change my preparation or tweak small things?‚Äô And that‚Äôs ultimately what you do ‚Ä¶ is just tweak really small things,‚Äù Brosmer said.

The Vikings and Lions are set to kickoff at 3:30 p.m. CT on Netflix.

title: Nuggets forward Cameron Johnson avoids major knee injury but will miss a few games, AP source says
description: The Denver Nuggets got good news Wednesday when an MRI revealed that forward Cameron Johnson suffered only a bone bruise to his right knee and not any ligament or structural damage, according to a person familiar with the medical test results.  The person spoke to The Associated Press on condition of anonymity because the team didn't announce the results of Johnson's MRI.  Johnson got hurt early in the fourth quarter of Denver's 131-130 loss at Dallas on Tuesday night.
fullText:
DENVER (AP) ‚Äî The Denver Nuggets got good news Wednesday when an MRI revealed that forward Cameron Johnson suffered only a bone bruise to his right knee and not any ligament or structural damage, according to a person familiar with the medical test results.

The person spoke to The Associated Press on condition of anonymity because the team didn't announce the results of Johnson's MRI.

Johnson got hurt early in the fourth quarter of Denver's 131-130 loss at Dallas on Tuesday night.

There isn't a timetable for his return but Johnson is expected to miss a few games. He's the third Nuggets starter sidelined by injury, joining Aaron Gordon (hamstring) and Christian Braun (ankle).

The Nuggets host the Minnesota Timberwolves on Christmas night.

AP NBA: https://apnews.com/hub/NBA

title: Patriots‚Äô Mike Vrabel Praises Rookie Defender‚Äôs Work Ethic
description: The Patriots are enjoying a fantastic season, and much of their impressive performance can be attributed to several standout first and second-year players on the roster. One of New England‚Äôs promising young players is rookie safety Craig Woodson, and head coach Mike Vrabel spoke about the impact Woodson has made this season. ‚ÄúWell, a lot [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
The Patriots are enjoying a fantastic season, and much of their impressive performance can be attributed to several standout first and second-year players on the roster.

One of New England‚Äôs promising young players is rookie safety Craig Woodson, and head coach Mike Vrabel spoke about the impact Woodson has made this season.

‚ÄúWell, a lot of experience, one,‚Äù Vrabel said. ‚ÄúI mean, Craig was in college for a while. We joke about it, but he‚Äôs started and played a lot of games, seen a lot of football. But I think he‚Äôs continued to learn, understand and develop, he‚Äôs gotten better each day, and he‚Äôs been durable and available. The more that you‚Äôre out there, usually the better that you get.‚Äù

The Patriots selected Woodson in the fourth round of the 2025 NFL Draft. During his five seasons at California, he played in 46 games. Although Woodson is just a rookie, the experience he gained in many college games can significantly contribute to his development as a player.

In 15 games this season, Woodson has recorded 74 combined tackles, four tackles for loss and two fumble recoveries.

If the Patriots want to make a postseason run, Woodson will need to deliver an outstanding performance along with the rest of the secondary to take down some of the best quarterbacks in the AFC.

title: Sioux Falls high schools gear up for third Presidents Bowl
description: SIOUX FALLS, S.D. (KELO) ‚Äî The four Sioux Falls public high schools are set to compete in the third annual Presidents Bowl basketball classic at the Sanford Pentagon on Monday and Tuesday. Each day of the event will feature two girls games and two boys games for a total of eight games among crosstown rivals [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
SIOUX FALLS, S.D. (KELO) ‚Äî The four Sioux Falls public high schools are set to compete in the third annual Presidents Bowl basketball classic at the Sanford Pentagon on Monday and Tuesday.

Each day of the event will feature two girls games and two boys games for a total of eight games among crosstown rivals over the two days.

‚ÄúThey know each other really well, so they like to winning against each other so they can have bragging rights ‚Äì east side, west side, whatever you want to talk about,‚Äù Jefferson head coach Tim Reck said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always fun to see those guys compete, and then afterwards, they‚Äôre laughing and joking about the game and things like that. So that‚Äôs always fun as well.‚Äù

The action begins each day at 11 a.m. with a new game tipping off every two hours. With the girls games opening the action for each session and the boys following, it creates an opportunity to draw more eye balls to the competition.

‚ÄúIt has, like a really good crowd for us, especially with the girls games,‚Äù Washington senior forward Rylan Kennett said. ‚ÄúLike when there‚Äôs all the guys games going on two, it brings more people to our game. So it‚Äôs kind of nice to be able to play in an atmosphere where we can maybe get more viewers and bring more attention to girls basketball in general.‚Äù

One of the biggest draws for the players is the chance to play at the Pentagon, which is recognized as one of the best venues in the country.

‚ÄúThe court‚Äôs very cool,‚Äù Lincoln junior guard Brody Schafer said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs like a heritage look. It‚Äôs like an old style look. It‚Äôs very cool. And then it‚Äôs just the atmosphere around it ‚Äì the smoke, the view board, all that stuff is stuff you don‚Äôt always get. So it‚Äôs just when you get it, you got to embrace it and take in the moment.

‚ÄúWhen they leave high school, they talk about the state tournaments, and they‚Äôre fun memories, but this is also one that they talk about as well,‚Äù Roosevelt head coach Mitch Begeman said. ‚ÄúThey got to play on Heritage Court and in the Sanford Pentagon, and they were treated very, very well. So, I think it‚Äôs just a special two days that we get to do this. And we‚Äôre very, very appreciative of that.‚Äù

The schedule for the two days is as follows: Lincoln and Roosevelt meet in the first two games of the Presidents Bowl on Dec. 29 with Washington and Jefferson squaring off later in the day. On Dec. 30, Jefferson and Lincoln battle in the early window, and Roosevelt and Washington close out the event.

fullText:
SIOUX FALLS, S.D. (KELO) ‚Äî Former USD men‚Äôs basketball player Stanley Umude signed a two-way contract with the San Antonio Spurs.

Umude was a three-time all-conference member including a first team selection in the 2018-19 and the 2020-21 seasons. He averaged 15 points per game over four years in Vermillion, including a career-high 21.6 as a senior with the Yotes.

He finished his college career with Arkansas and has played in 47 NBA games across three seasons with the Pistons and Bucks.

title: Steve Kerr admits the Warriors are a 'fading dynasty' amidst all the team's struggles
description: The Golden State Warriors are not the team they once were, and longtime head coach Steve Kerr admits that.
fullText:
Steve Kerr admits the Warriors are a 'fading dynasty' amidst all the team's struggles originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Golden State Warriors are one of the most successful teams of the 21st century. They have four championships with Steve Kerr as the head coach and Stephen Curry as the superstar. Of course, they also had Draymond Green and Klay Thompson across all championships, which made them a modern NBA dynasty.

Unfortunately, the Warriors' core has aged, as they are in their mid-to-late 30s now. Kerr admits that the Warriors are not at their best anymore, which is an inevitability, considering Father Time is undefeated.

In today's NBA, the Warriors are one of the teams that are stuck in limbo. They want to be successful, as seen with the quality of players they have on the roster. Unfortunately, their core might be too old to compete against the younger teams like the Oklahoma City Thunder and the San Antonio Spurs.

Kerr wants his team to remain competitive, but it might not happen anymore because the Warriors' time has passed. They were once a dynasty that almost every other NBA team feared, but now, they are not seen as a title contender anymore.

More:¬†Cam Johnson and Trey Murphy believe Steph Curry is the most unique player ever

This is a new look at the Warriors because many have seen them as a perennial contender for almost a decade. Today, they are eighth in the Western Conference standings with a 15-15 record. This is not what people are used to seeing, which is why Kerr is a bit tentative with his current roster.

"I feel really good about where our team is on the floor, where we're heading, I see the potential in doing exactly what we did last year, to really go on a run, and give ourselves a chance... Most importantly for me, is that there is beauty in the struggle. We are no longer the '17 Warriors dominating the league, we are a fading dynasty, we know that," Kerr said about his team and their chances this season.

He wants his team to play well, as he believes in his players. However, that might not be enough because the Warriors are not the same team they once were during their dynasty era with Curry, Green, Thompson, and Kevin Durant.

Moving forward, the Warriors will work hard to become a top team again, but it is looking unlikely, considering the core's age and how well the rest of the NBA has improved at beating the Warriors.

title: 1 Christmas Gift Reds Should Give Their Fans
description: The Reds must add another outfielder this offseason.
fullText:
The Cincinnati Reds' left field situation is up in the air, so they should acquire a new player at that position as a Christmas gift to their fanbase. Unfortunately for the Reds, former NL MVP Cody Bellinger is considered "a long shot to land in Cincinnati," per MLB.com's Mark Sheldon.

"Corner outfielders on the free-agent market include Cody Bellinger and Ryan O'Hearn, although O'Hearn played more at first base last season. A former National League MVP, Bellinger would seem more of a long shot to land in Cincinnati," he wrote. "Trade Deadline acquisition Miguel Andujar, who finished the season with the Reds while burnishing his reputation for beating up left-handed pitchers, also remains on the market."

"The spot could also be filled by an internal option," he continued.

O'Hearn has since signed a two-year deal with the Pittsburgh Pirates, per MLB.com.

Another high-profile free agent at the position is Kyle Tucker, but he'll be expensive. The 28-year-old has a market value of 10 years, $401.7 million ($40.2 million average annual salary). Plus, teams like the Toronto Blue Jays are interested and have extra incentive to pursue him, via FanSided's Brandon Glick..

‚ÄúThis conversation will really become timely if the Blue Jays sign Kyle Tucker, who would immediately displace [Anthony] Santander in right field,‚Äù Glick wrote. ‚ÄúWith George Springer taking up all of the at-bats at DH and Daulton Varsho locked into the starting spot in center field, Tucker‚Äôs presence would effectively mean that there‚Äôs one open spot for all of the aforementioned players.‚Äù

However, there's a more attainable option on the open market who is also a familiar face.

Jesse Winker could be a cost-effective and reliable player to add to the outfield group. The veteran slashed just .226/.309/.400 with one homer and 10 RBI over 26 games for the New York Mets last season, but had a .764 OPS across 145 games in 2024 and an .800-plus OPS each year from 2017-2021 with the Reds. Additionally, he has just a one-year, $5.4 million market value, per Spotrac.

Cincinnati drafted Winker No. 49 overall in 2012, and he made his big-league debut in 2017. The club then traded him along with Eugenio Suarez to the Seattle Mariners in March 2022, who then traded him to the Milwaukee Brewers that December. He then signed with the Washington Nationals in February 2024, who traded him to the Mets that July.

Winker could slot in Cincinnati's left field spot next to TJ Friedl in center and Noelvi Marte in right.

title: Promising Goaltending Tandem Leading Way For WBS Penguins
description: The Pittsburgh Penguins may be struggling at the NHL level, but they have two promising goaltending prospects waiting in the wings and dominating the AHL
fullText: It was yet another successful slate of games last weekend for the Wilkes-Barre/Scranton (WBS) Penguins, who can't seem to stop collecting points. And two young Pittsburgh Penguins' goaltending prospects have been leading the way for the WBS Penguins - as well as the AHL as a whole. Young netminder Sergei Murashov earned wins on Friday and Sunday, while Joel Blomqvist was the standout in a 3-2 loss to the Hartford Wolf Pack on Saturday, as he stopped 32 of 35 Hartford shots on goal. Murashov and Blomqvist have combined to make a formidable tandem for WBS this season, and their play has elevated an already-talented team. Murashov, 21, has simply continued to dominate the AHL level. He leads the AHL in both save percentage (.943) and goals-against average (1.55), and he is 10-2-0 with two shutouts. His latest performance on Sunday - a 3-1 win over the Hershey Bears - featured 26 saves on 27 shots, including 14 in the first period alone. And back on Dec. 10, Murashov made 20 saves in the first period en route to a 3-0 shutout victory against the Hartford Wolf Pack. As has been mentioned many times before, the 6-foot-2, 185-pound netminder has dominated every level of professional hockey he's played at, and his video game-esque numbers this season are showing that his full-time NHL arrival is not far off. He does have five NHL games under his belt this season, posting a 1-1-2 record with an .897 save percentage and a 2.56 goals-against average. Crosby Reaches Milestone For Second Consecutive Game The big milestone may have come for Pittsburgh Penguins' captain Sidney Crosby on Sunday against the Montreal Canadiens, when he surpassed Mario Lemieux to become the Penguins' all-time leader in points.  As for Blomqvist? Well, after an injury caused him to miss most of training camp and the first month and a half of the AHL season, he has gotten off to a great start. In eight games, he is 5-2-1 with a .935 save percentage and a 1.81 goals-against average. Aside from one start on Nov. 29 - when he allowed four goals on 12 shots - he has only had a save percentage below .930 in a game one time. This is impressive stuff from the 23-year-old, who debuted with the Penguins last season to some mixed results. He started off well in his first stint with the NHL club, posting a .903 save percentage across eight appearances, but his second stint didn't go nearly as well. Overall, he had an .885 save percentage and a 3.81 goals-against average. The results that the Penguins are getting from these two youngsters in WBS is a very encouraging sign, especially for a team that just traded its No. 1 goaltender to the Edmonton Oilers in Tristan Jarry. The NHL club is giving Stuart Skinner - who the Penguins acquired in that trade - and Arturs Silovs some runway to prove themselves, but with the team in freefall, it stands to reason that at least one of them could have a relatively short leash. Penguins Prospect Makes Team USA World Junior Team Pittsburgh Penguins prospect Will Horcoff has made the Team USA World Junior team. Silovs has struggled in recent games, posting an .815 save percentage over his last six appearances. Skinner has an .831 save percentage in three starts with the Penguins so far. In other words, neither has done a particularly stellar job up to this point to suggest that they can become starters at the NHL level. Murashov has the quickness, athleticism, calmness, and confidence for a pretty high NHL ceiling, and many believe he can be a solution going foward for the Penguins. Blomqvist also has some pedigree, even if he has struggled to stay healthy over the last several years. All in all, it will be interesting to see how the Penguins handle their goaltending situation for the rest of the season, especially since the team has only won one game in its last 10 after a remarkable 8-2-2 start to the season in the month of October. Both Murashov and Blomqvist figure to be key parts of the Penguins' future, and the future may just get here a little faster than anyone could have anticipated. Takeaways: Penguins' Push Comes Up Short, Maple Leafs' Stars Come Up Big After a dramatic 4-3 shootout win against the Montreal Canadiens on Sunday, the Pittsburgh Penguins hoped to carry some of that momentum into their final game before the holiday break on Tuesday against the Toronto Maple Leafs. Bookmark THN - Pittsburgh Penguins on your Google News tab¬†to follow the latest Penguins news, roster moves, player features, and more!

title: Reds sign former Red Sox 1st-round pick to free agent contract
description: Cincinnati is trying to provide thump for a bargain.
fullText:
Reds sign former Red Sox 1st-round pick to free agent contract originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Cincinnati Reds have yet to land a big bat in free agency.

They may be trying to add some thump to their lineup from the bargain bin.

On Wednesday, they signed Michael Chavis to a minor league contract with an invite to spring training, according to ESPN's Kiley McDaniel.

There's some legitimate intrigue to this signing.

Chavis is 30 now, but he entered pro ball as a first-round pick in 2014 by the Boston Red Sox.

He has more than 1,000 MLB at bats.

Chavis spent parts of three seasons with Boston, then parts of two with the Pirates before appearing in a partial campaign with the Nationals.

MORE:¬†Team USA's projected WBC lineup is incredible

All told, he's a .238 hitter with a .685 OPS.

But Chavis has had a couple big stints.

His rookie campaign with Boston featured 18 home runs in 95 games and a .766 OPS.

Then in 2022 with the Pirates, he played in 129 games and hit 14 home runs. That was after an .857 OPS in the latter stages of the 2021 season once he joined Pittsburgh.

Chavis hasn't played in the majors since 2023, but he's looking for a path back.

The Reds are a playoff contender with a great rotation that could really use a breakthrough bat. Maybe Chavis can be that guy.

title: Proposed Giants trade sees San Francisco land $50 million All-Star, Gold Glove to complete star outfield trio with Jung Hoo Lee, Heliot Ramos
description: This would provide some needed outfield depth for the Giants.
fullText:
Proposed Giants trade sees San Francisco land $50 million All-Star, Gold Glove to complete star outfield trio with Jung Hoo Lee, Heliot Ramos originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The San Francisco Giants had a mediocre season in 2025, finishing 81-81. Now, this offseason, they should focus on upgrading their pitching, but there is one place they could upgrade in the field.

That place is the last outfield slot, as Heliot Ramos and Jung Hoo Lee occupy the other spots. Fansided‚Äôs Chris Landers proposes the Giants fill that spot by trading for Chicago White Sox All-Star Luis Robert Jr.

MORE:¬†Guardians predicted to sign $65 million three-time All-Star, two-time Silver Slugger to upgrade from Kyle Manzardo

‚ÄúThe Giants are an outfielder short right now, with very little reliable depth behind Jung Hoo Lee and Heliot Ramos. That needs to change if this team wants to finally get back to the postseason in year two of Buster Posey's reign, and while a miracle run at Tucker can't be ruled out entirely, history suggests it's not in the cards‚Ä¶A Robert trade (surrounding someone like Landon Roupp or Carson Whisenhunt, maybe?) would shift Lee to right and give San Francisco and perfectly solid starting trio. He'd excel defensively in the spacious confines of Oracle Park, and the offensive question marks don't loom quite as large for a team currently staring at replacement-level options in his stead,‚Äù Landers wrote.

Robert slashed .223/.297/.364/.661 with 12 doubles, 14 home runs, and 53 RBI in 110 games played. However, a change in scenery may be the spark he needs to have a bounce-back season.

MORE:¬†Reds predicted to sign $70.5 million three-time All-Star, two-time batting champ as upgrade over Matt McLain

Robert would also be a short-term option. He has a year left on his current contract, with a club option for 2027. If the Giants like what they see, they could sign him to a long-term contract.

If the Giants don‚Äôt want to go for Kyle Tucker, they definitely should consider Robert as a cost-effective option. Hopefully, they decide soon, as Robert is one of the hottest names on the trade market.

title: Mike Macdonald expresses disapproval of Seahawks LB suspension
description: Macdonald had this to say in defense of the linebacker's one-game suspension.
fullText:
Mike Macdonald expresses disapproval of Seahawks LB suspension originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Last week, the Seattle Seahawks got their biggest win of the season with a win over their division rival, the Los Angeles Rams, in an overtime thriller on 'Thursday Night Football' with a walk-off two-point conversion.

Although the win was huge for the team, it puts them in firm control of home-field advantage and the playoffs running through Lumen Field; not everything from that game was good news for the Hawks.

After the game, it was announced that linebacker Derick Hall had been suspended for one game after being accused of intentionally stepping on Rams guard Kevin Dotson. Hall attempted to appeal the decision after it became clear that the incident could be seen as accidental to some, but the suspension was upheld.

Even though the result of the situation was unfortunate, as it resulted in Dotson suffering a sprained right ankle and having to be carted off the field, it should be looked upon as a wasted appeal, because it does not look as if Hall was intending to injure Dotson purposely.

More:¬†Seahawks get bad news from NFL on Derick Hall's suspension

Seahawks head coach Mike Macdonald would agree with that statement, and he made it clear how he feels about the suspension being upheld when asked about the situation during a media session on Wednesday.

"We accept the decision, even if we don't agree with it. I refuse to believe there was ill intent," Macdonald declared in the press conference.

Filling the void at outside linebacker could be tough, as they have a challenging road game in Week 17 against the Carolina Panthers. He has been a key member of the defensive rotation, playing the majority of snaps whenever he is available.

title: Is Luka Doncic playing on Christmas Day vs. Rockets? Final status for Lakers star
description: Doncic missed L.A.'s last game with a calf contusion.
fullText:
Is Luka Doncic playing on Christmas Day vs. Rockets? Final status for Lakers star originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Christmas Day is one of the biggest dates on the NBA calendar every year, and 2025 will be no different. There are a total of five NBA games on the holiday this year, with one of the games being an intriguing matchup between the Los Angeles Lakers and Houston Rockets.

Both the Lakers and Rockets are jockeying for playoff positioning in the competitive Western Conference. The Lakers are currently fourth in the conference standings at 19-9 while the Rockets are two spots behind them at 17-10.

The Christmas Day stage provides a platform for stars to shine, and luckily the Lakers will have one of the league‚Äôs biggest stars available for the game.

After missing L.A.‚Äôs last game with a left calf contusion, Luka Doncic is expected to play against Houston, according to ESPN‚Äôs Shams Charania.

This is obviously good news for the Lakers and basketball fans alike, as Doncic is one of the most exiting ‚Äì and productive ‚Äì players in the league. On the season he‚Äôs averaging a league-leading 34.1 points per game to go along with 8.8 rebounds and 8.6 assists.

More Lakers news:¬†LeBron James gets brutally honest about having to play on Christmas Day

There will be no shortage of star power in the game between L.A. and Houston. In addition to Doncic, LeBron James will be available for the Lakers, and he‚Äôll face off against a familiar foe in Kevin Durant.

That duo will combine to make some NBA history when they take the floor on Christmas. The pair has scored a total of 73,630 points in the league, which represents the most combined points in a head-to-head matchup ever.

The holiday matchup between L.A. and Houston will be the first of three meetings between the two teams on the season. They'll meet again twice in March.

title: Washington Commanders vs. Dallas Cowboys: Week 17 fantasy start/sit
description: Here are players to start and sit in fantasy football from the Washington Commanders and Dallas Cowboys Week 17 matchup.
fullText:
The Washington Commanders will face the Dallas Cowboys at Northwest Stadium in Landover, Maryland, in one of three Christmas Day NFL games.

The Commanders will be without backup quarterback Marcus Mariota, leaving Josh Johnson to start with Jeff Driskel as the backup. Without Mariota, the Commanders' offense becomes one-dimensional and easy to defend.

This is a game for bragging rights at this point, as both teams have been eliminated from the playoffs. It's a divisional matchup, though, and both teams want the win. Anything can happen in a divisional game, and this one is no exception, which is why there are still players with value in fantasy football leagues.

If you've made it this far into the fantasy football season, congratulations. If you roster any of the players on either of these teams, here are some players to start and sit in Week 17.

The Commanders allow the 2nd-most fantasy points to quarterbacks in the entire league. Prescott is a solid quarterback with decent receivers, and he'll be facing a Commanders secondary that is missing some key pieces. Prescott is likely to feast against the Commanders on Christmas Day, making him a must-start in this game.

Treylon Burks has seen an increased number of targets in recent weeks, but he's not reliable enough to have fantasy value against the Cowboys this week. If Marcus Mariota plays, he will target Terry McLaurin and Deebo Samuel. If Josh Johnson starts, he could target Burks, but they didn't have a lot of success last week. Don't expect much out of Burks in Week 17.

Williams is currently questionable with a neck injury, and with the playoffs out of reach for the Cowboys, he might not suit up, so keep an eye on that. He did practice in a limited capacity on Tuesday, and if he suits up on Thursday, he will face a Commanders defense that ranks 28th in the league and allows the 4th-most fantasy points to running backs. He is a must-start if he is healthy enough to play.

Despite the Commanders' current reliance on the ground game, McNichols isn't a viable option at running back this week. Chris Rodriguez Jr. and Jacory Croskey-Merritt are the top two running backs for the Commanders, and while McNichols has dual ground and air abilities, he isn't getting the same touches as the other two backs, and he rarely finds the end zone.

The Cowboys actually allow more points to wide receivers than running backs, but they still allow the 6th-most points to running backs in the NFL. The only way the Commanders' wide receivers have any fantasy value is if Marcus Mariota plays. If he doesn't, the Commanders will rely heavily on the ground game. This means that Wild Bill and Chris Rodriguez Jr. will get plenty of touches. Croskey-Merritt has scored in each of the last two games and could have a big game if the Commanders are forced to keep the ball on the ground.

This article originally appeared on Commanders Wire: Washington Commanders: Week 17 fantasy start/sit vs. Dallas Cowboys

title: Hawaii stuns Cal in 35-31 in Hawaii Bowl on backup QB Drew Weaver‚Äôs last-minute TD pass
description: Backup quarterback Drew Weaver threw a 22-yard touchdown pass to Nick Cenacle with 10 seconds left, and Hawaii rallied for a 35-31 victory over California in the Hawaii Bowl.
fullText:
HONOLULU (AP) ‚Äî Backup quarterback Drew Weaver threw a 22-yard touchdown pass to Nick Cenacle with 10 seconds left, and Hawaii rallied for a 35-31 victory over California in a thrilling Hawaii Bowl on Wednesday night.

Weaver entered the game after Micah Alejado took a hard hit on the previous play. With the Rainbow Warriors (9-4) in range for a tying field goal, coach Timmy Chang took a shot at the end zone, and Cenacle got between two defensive backs and made the contested catch.

Chang, Hawaii‚Äôs fourth-year coach who had a record-setting career as the Rainbow Warriors‚Äô quarterback from 2000-04, led his program to its first nine-win season since 2019 ‚Äî when Nick Rolovich, currently Cal‚Äôs interim coach, guided Hawaii to a 10-5 record.

Alejado finished 32 of 46 for 274 yards and three touchdowns, helping Hawaii rally from an early 21-0 deficit. Pofele Ashlock had 14 catches for 123 yards and two TDs for the Rainbow Warriors, who scored 22 points in the fourth quarter.

Cal (7-6) pulled ahead 31-28 with 1:57 left on a 1-yard touchdown run by Hawaii-born freshman quarterback Jaron-Keawe Sagapolutele, who finished with 343 yards passing and a touchdown.

Alejado‚Äôs 17-yard touchdown pass to Brandon White with 7:19 left gave Hawaii a 28-24 lead. The Rainbow Warriors tied it early in the fourth quarter when Alejado connected with Ashlock for their second TD and then completed a 2-point conversion pass to Cam Barfield.

Cal took a 21-0 lead early in the second quarter on Anthony League‚Äôs 8-yard TD run.

Cal was picked to finish third-to-last in the Atlantic Coast Conference preseason media poll, but finished the season tied for seventh in the ACC. Coach Justin Wilcox was fired last month and will be replaced next season by Oregon defensive coordinator Tosh Lupoi. Sagapolutele has committed to staying with the program in 2026.

Hawaii has plenty to build on as it enters Chang‚Äôs fifth season. Although leading receiver Jackson Harris announced his intention to transfer and did not play Wednesday, Alejado and Ashlock have said they plan to return.

Cal will host UCLA on Sept. 5, 2026.

Hawaii will also begin next season in the Bay Area when it visits Stanford on Aug. 29.

title: Kyle Shanahan has the highest praise for Caleb Williams going into Week 17 matchup
description: Shanahan sees the greatness that lies within Caleb Williams
fullText:
Kyle Shanahan has the highest praise for Caleb Williams going into Week 17 matchup originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Coming into the 2024 NFL draft, all the hype was around QB Caleb Williams out of USC. As is the case with most highly touted prospects, the team that lands them loves them, and the rest can't stand them.

Caleb Williams has been on a tear throughout his 2nd season with Chicago, and over the last few weeks in particular, folks around the league are starting to take notice.

More:¬†Caleb Williams' OT throw to DJ Moore wasn't just the play of the game; PFF views it as much more.

Among all those who are jumping on the Caleb Williams train, San Francisco 49ers head coach Kyle Shanahan was one of them.

When speaking to the media prior to his team's Week 17 matchup with the Chicago Bears, Shanahan had incredibly high praise for Williams.

There are a handful of NFL coaches who are known to just understand the QB position at a higher level. Kyle Shanahan is one of those offensive-minded coaches.

He's consistently gotten the best out of his QBs during his tenure in San Francisco, with his latest project being turning 'Mr Irrelevant' Brock Purdy into a legitimate starting-caliber QB.

When he was asked about Caleb Williams leading up to facing off against him on Sunday, Shanahan had nothing but the utmost praise.

49ers HC Kyle Shanahan with very high praise for Bears QB Caleb Williams:

‚ÄúCaleb is one of the best throwers and athletic quarterbacks I‚Äôve ever seen. He makes some big-time throws. Extremely scary on the perimeter. It makes sense why he‚Äôs playing at such a high level.‚Äù üëÄ

üé•:‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/acO3r6A9P7

‚Äî Bearsszn (@bearszn) December 25, 2025

Shanahan said, " Caleb is one of the best throwers and most athletic QBs I've ever seen in terms of his height, weight, and speed. He makes some big-time throws. Extremely scary on the perimeter. He can hold onto the ball for a while ‚Äî not in a bad way, but by creating stuff, which makes coverages have to hold out forever."

He sees greatness in Williams and rightfully so, as he's looked fantastic over these last few weeks.

When the two teams play each other on Sunday, the 49ers will be fighting for their playoff lives. Unfortunately for San Francisco, I'm not sure Kyle Shanahan's kind words will be enough to stop Caleb Williams from putting on another incredible performance.

title: Sixth At Christmas: Our Writers On Sunderland‚Äôs Yuletide High!
description: Beyond our wildest dreams? A taste of things to come? Our writers have their say on our 2025/26 campaign so far!
fullText:
It‚Äôs been a season like no other in my lifetime ‚Äî not just a season, actually, but a year that‚Äôs gone beyond my wildest dreams.

The storyline of 2025 for Sunderland has been like no other ‚Äî and it genuinely could‚Äôve been the script of a movie. The way we‚Äôve won big games would‚Äôve been perfect for a Netflix series but alas, they didn‚Äôt have the foresight to stick around for the real glory years on Wearside.

I didn‚Äôt think we‚Äôd struggle this season, but I didn‚Äôt think we‚Äôd be sixth at Christmas either. Nobody could‚Äôve expected us to have achieved what we‚Äôve achieved, so it‚Äôs a credit to everyone at the club for managing to get as far as we have, but the hard work hasn‚Äôt ended yet and if anything, the season is only really just starting.

I heard Alan Pardew on the radio last week talking about how as a player and manager, you don‚Äôt really take notice of the table until after Christmas, as it‚Äôs at about that point where you can see what you‚Äôre capable of achieving and what it‚Äôs going to take to get there.

We‚Äôre sixth, but we can‚Äôt take that for granted or rest on our laurels.

We‚Äôve got to be proactive in the transfer market; we‚Äôve got to make sure that our squad is ready to challenge for a top eight finish, and then who knows what might happen ‚Äî we could be sitting here at the end of the season having qualified for Europe for the first time in over fifty years, which would be the cherry on top of what is already a delicious-looking cake.

Our festive fixtures are really tough.

Leeds are in great form and are a better team than people will probably give them credit for, and then we‚Äôve got Manchester City who are the best side we‚Äôve faced this season and are probably going to win the league.

If we can get through those with some positive results, the belief that we can achieve something great this season will only grow ‚Äî and that would be perfect as we look to start our charge towards FA Cup glory.

Depending on one‚Äôs age of course, for many fans this will be one of the most satisfying and happy Christmases from a Sunderland point of view for a very long time ‚Äî and in my own mind, only the Peter Reid days can challenge it

It‚Äôs easy to get greedy and want more but I think the vast majority of supporters will be overjoyed at our position and performances this calendar year as a whole.

I‚Äôm usually a positive person and I always knew the good times would return ‚Äî I just didn‚Äôt know when. The arrival of Kyril Louis-Dreyfus was the spark that made me start believing the good times were on the horizon again, and although we achieved a long-awaited promotion back to the top flight, I didn‚Äôt expect us to perform so well this season.

What a lift and what a boost to all fans and to the region! Our long term history has always been that of a top club, but our recent history of fixtures against Cheltenham, Accrington, Shrewsbury really does hit home ‚Äî not only how aboutbdark those days were, but how far we‚Äôve come.

I‚Äôd hope we can continue on this trajectory by beating Leeds to reach thirty points by the new year, and then push on for Europe. Some might think this would be too soon but just like teams scrapping to get out of the Championship, you can‚Äôt choose when an opportunity may arise that puts your club in a favourable position.

European fixtures would require a deeper and bigger squad to cope with the rigours of midweek games, but I have every faith in our backroom staff and management. I think I would be a tad disappointed if we didn‚Äôt get a top eight spot this season, and an announcement about a ground capacity extension before the end of 2026.

Well, that‚Äôs what I‚Äôve written to Father¬†Christmas for, anyway!

Reflecting on the first half of the season, it has to be classed as a massive achievement and way beyond the expectations and even the dreams of many.

Sixth at Christmas is nothing short of incredible for a side who finished the previous Championship season as we did, and came up via the playoffs. Absolutely amazing ‚Äî and superlatives are nowhere near enough.

If we‚Äôd been asked what we hoped for when we lifted the playoff trophy at Wembley, I doubt anyone would‚Äôve asked for a top six Premier League berth by Christmas, and those who did would‚Äôve been laughed at vigorously by red and white pals almost as much as by the black and white ones.

That Tommy Watson goal went in only seven months ago. The progress since then has been incredible, and hats off to the owners and all the club employees working around them for getting us to this point.

The thing that stands out for me is the pre-planning and then execution of the strategy, and the size of the balls of the club‚Äôs owners to go for it as they have.

It‚Äôs like chalk and cheese compared to the sad recent past; these people are serious operators who want our club to succeed and are not here to make a quick buck.

Nobody would‚Äôve guessed we would spend ¬£155 million on fourteen players or that we‚Äôd replace the core of the team that got us up with such high-quality footballers, retaining the select few that clearly had enough to make it already.

Even if some fans did hope for that, could they expect the club to bring in such amazing bargains who clicked with the club as they have ‚Äî players who ‚Äúget what we‚Äôre about‚Äù and gel as solidly as they have? I don‚Äôt think anyone expected how this has panned out at all, and it‚Äôs bloody marvellous.

Gone are the days of the payday piss-takers. These lads would dive on a live grenade to stop a goal for Sunderland and how they‚Äôve established this atmosphere, camaraderie, team spirit and collective positive attitude is way beyond me.

During the coming weeks, we need to stay grounded, gathering all the points we can despite the temporary impact on the starting eleven from AFCON and using this as a spell where we look at wider squad options and allow fringe players to prove they can play at this level and compete with those who‚Äôve usurped them since August.

It‚Äôs a time for understanding if we lose a couple of games; a time to be literally fans come what may, and to avoid any poor results distracting us from where we are.

Before all of that, we can tuck into our turkey and trimmings with a big fat smile on our faces. As a fan base, we deserve that after all the crap we‚Äôve been through.

Nobody deserves that right more than my Sunderland AFC family.

title: Shedeur Sanders speaks on how his rookie season has went
description: This answer could be shocking to some.
fullText:
Shedeur Sanders speaks on how his rookie season has went originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

For the Cleveland Browns, this season has felt different from the others, not in terms of team success; they are still among the league's bottom with a 3-12 record, but there is a different vibe around the team.

A significant reason for that has been the drama surrounding the team at the quarterback position, and that all started at last April's NFL draft, where the top draft prospect, Shedeur Sanders was not drafted until the fifth round by the Browns and the team also went on to draft Heisman finalist, Dillion Gabriel as well to add to a QB room that already had veteran Joe Flacco and former first round pick, Kenny Pickett.

With that many signal callers on the roster, Sanders started out getting the short end of the stick, being listed as QB4 on the depth chart. Since then, the quarterback has climbed his way up and been the starter for the team since Week 12, and when discussing his journey thus far, Sanders had this to say.

MORE:¬†Trade Myles Garrett? Media calling for Browns to deal star

"I'm super appreciative that everything happened how it happened...If I were to look back from the Ravens game to now, I would say I improved in experience," Sanders said.

Sanders also later acknowledged that the way things went for him allowed him to learn more about the way of life.

Sanders' responses truly show how well he handles adversity, which should be a welcoming sight for Browns fans.

However, the season is not over just yet for Sanders and the Browns, as they will host the Pittsburgh Steelers for their last home game of the season in Week 16, then close out the 2025 season on the road against Joe Burrow and the Cincinnati Bengals.

title: On This Day (25th Dec 1940): Len Duns Stars In A Christmas Cracker
description: Len Duns stole the show in this Christmas friendly at Roker Park
fullText:
The breakout of war in the early 1940s ultimately put a halt to any competitive football in England at this time. This meant that regional leagues and friendlies were the only games in which any club in the country could participate, with the funds raised from these friendly games going towards the war effort.

For the 1940-41 season, Bill Murray‚Äôs team opted against playing any regional games with other teams in the area like they had done the season before, because heavy travel restrictions had meant that people could only travel within a five-mile radius of their home. This clearly would have put a huge limit on the amount of people that could attend in such dangerous circumstances.

Generally, football had taken a back seat with much more pressing matters on the minds of the entire population, and according to the fantastic Sunderland AFC: The Absolute Record book, Bill Murray was also focusing more on organising fitness drills for troops stationed in Durham rather than the football club.

On this day, the team did play a friendly match against the Sunderland Police at Roker Park, and it certainly didn‚Äôt disappoint as Sunderland outside-right Len Duns played a starring role in an 11-5 victory. Duns scored four goals and created many of the rest in an entertaining friendly match that was akin to a rugby union scoreline.

With many footballers enrolling with the police force as part of their duty during wartime, the police outfit had a reasonably decent team on show; however, just before kick-off their goalkeeper cried off, with outside-right Frank Coulthard having to go in goal.

Coulthard‚Äôs presence in goal made it easier for the Sunderland side and led to the huge scoreline that they put up for the game.

In another interesting point from this game, Oxford University captain James McFarlane made a guest appearance for the home side as he was home for the holidays visiting his family.

In what was an incredibly entertaining game, it is safe to say that any spectators that turned up for the game certainly got value for their money.

title: Roker Report‚Äôs Alternative Christmas Speech: 2025 Has Been A Year To Savour
description: Merry Christmas, Lads and Lasses - let‚Äôs hope that 2026 gives us as much as 2025 did.
fullText:
A very merry Christmas to one and all. A yuletide fact for everyone: did you know Santa‚Äôs outfit is red and white because he‚Äôs a massive Lads fan?

There may be truth in that; there may not. But if he has a Sky Sports package (or IPTV for those of you on the naughty list ‚Äì the elves disapprove) he surely will have had a front-row seat up there in Lapland to a calendar year that, even for Sunderland AFC, you could describe as unfettered carnage.

This time, however, it‚Äôs not because we‚Äôve just borne witness to 12 months strewn with the bodies of defeats, failed objectives, board protests, managerial sackings, and fan unrest. Not to say this was the case then, but if 2024 was very much Sunderland pulling itself from the slurry that was Michael Beale‚Äôs tenure, 2025 was a real ‚Äì as the Americans might say ‚Äì banner year. The last 12 months have been a vintage of Roman√©e-Conti Pinot Noir proportions, which I‚Äôm reliably informed by Google AI retails for a healthy five-figure sum.

Talking of alcohol, rumour has it in Sunderland there is a new drinking game taking the city‚Äôs drinking establishments by storm. It‚Äôs called ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôd said a year ago‚Äù in which all the participants must each begin by saying the phrase and then coming up with an iconic SAFC moment from 2025. The last person to fail to name one has to drink.

Apparently it‚Äôs the longest drinking game in the world.

The list is endless: the play-off win, the Tommy Watson 95th-minute winner, the Dan Ballard goal, riding high in the Premier League, beating the Visitors, the awesome tifos, breaking the Coventry hoodoo, winning at ‚ÄôBoro, being a place and a couple of points behind Liverpool‚Ä¶ at Christmas. Winning in the last minute at Stamford Bridge, swatting aside West Ham on the opening day, coming back from two down at home for the first time in 40-odd years in the top flight, signing Granit Xhaka, breaking our transfer record many times over‚Ä¶

You can feel the huge sense of pride in the city, which football aside is very clearly a place on the up. And that is hugely satisfying.

Of course at Christmas there is the annual tradition of naming the turkey. Last year R√©gis cooked up an absolute storm in the Bendelow household. But who gets the title this year? Some may say it‚Äôs a one-bird contest with Sunderland‚Äôs man-of-steel Granit Xhaka, who turned up at the Stadium of Light in July basted and pre-stuffed and giblets removed. However, I‚Äôm tempted to give it to someone who has had a year which could only arguably be better in 2026 if he won the World Cup with Northern Ireland: Dan Ballard.

I‚Äôm told Wearside‚Äôs favourite talisman has had to start bringing a bag-for-life to matches because he‚Äôs run out of pockets to put all of the division‚Äôs leading attackers in. He‚Äôs a man of such dependability and substance you‚Äôd think that Newton‚Äôs third law was based on one of his tackles. The man would head a tank trap away if you asked him to. Would you like any more metaphors? No? Well, all I‚Äôll say is rumour has it there‚Äôs a Hollywood blockbuster in the works about Big Dan Ballard. Still, if that doesn‚Äôt happen he can content himself with having my turkey named after him.

The message this year is, though, one of pride. About, as R√©gis would probably say, connection. Good connection. We‚Äôre talking full fibre. Because the connection between the club, the fans, and the city has arguably never been stronger. Both figuratively and physically, as we saw in October with the opening of the new Keel Crossing ‚Äì something which has been an absolute revelation.

Who knows what the future will hold, but what has transpired over the last few months has resulted in a club transformed. The hierarchy has hacked its way through arguably two seasons‚Äô worth of redevelopment in one short summer, and the results have been remarkable. What might this mean for the rest of the campaign? Who knows, but it should hopefully ensure a bright future.

And doesn‚Äôt it feel good ‚Äì life ‚Äì when your football team is doing well? I‚Äôm trying to bottle this feeling, but also appreciate it now ‚Äì because these are the good days.

I must end with a couple of lines on a Sunderland legend: Gary Rowell. He wasn‚Äôt someone who jetted in from elsewhere, without being able to differentiate his pink slices from his Lambton Worms. No, a local lad who lived the dream so many thousands of us would wish for. Put simply, if you were to design your football career and the moments that defined it, you would create in your mind the one Gary had with this club ‚Äì his club.

He was a man whose achievements and legend transcend generations of Sunderland fans, his greatest hits being passed down from old to young. But what a hit ‚Äì that hat-trick ‚Äì of Bohemian Rhapsody proportions. And that, in essence, is football fandom. He contributed an immense amount to the legend of this football club, and it is without doubt that many of us will be raising a glass to Lord Rowell of Seaham when the big day arrives. If anyone deserves it, he does, because we all owe him thanks many times over. What a legacy to leave.

Have a fantastic Christmas all you Sunderland fans ‚Äì and all the best for 2026.

title: Casemiro could be about to reunite with former arch-rival
description: Manchester United have quite the dilemma on their hands with regards to the future of midfield general Casemiro.After a difficult time initially under Ruben Amorim, the Brazilian has fought back to wi...
fullText:
Manchester United have quite the dilemma on their hands with regards to the future of midfield general Casemiro.

After a difficult time initially under Ruben Amorim, the Brazilian has fought back to win over the head coach and is currently one of the first names on the team sheet.

However, he is 33, and that shows on the pitch with the former Real Madrid superstar completing 90 minutes only three times this season.

His contract ends next summer, but the club have the option of triggering a one-year extension clause included in his deal.

But since the Brazil international is the highest-paid player in the squad, INEOS have no intention of paying the same wages.

25/26 season stats via Transfermarkt

While Amorim prefers to keep the five-time Champions League winner, the co-owners remain keen on reducing the wage bill.

Hence, new contract talks have involved a massive wage reduction. Multiple clubs are ready to offer him a much larger pay packet, including long-term admirers in the Saudi Pro League.

However, a move across the Atlantic to the MLS seems to be the likeliest next destination, with three clubs eager to recruit a leader like Casemiro.

Teamtalk have named New York City FC, Austin FC, and Lionel Messi‚Äôs Inter Miami as potential options.

‚ÄúMultiple MLS clubs are actively working to lure the midfielder stateside, viewing him as a marquee signing capable of elevating the league‚Äôs profile further.

‚ÄúSources highlight interest from sides like New York City FC, Austin FC, and Inter Miami, who see Casemiro‚Äôs winning mentality as ideal for mentoring emerging talent in a less physically demanding environment.

‚ÄúThe appeal of life in the US, combined with competitive salaries under Designated Player rules, makes MLS the ‚Äúmost likely‚Äù next step if United‚Äôs proposal falls short of his expectations.‚Äù

Whether the defensive midfielder will agree to United‚Äôs proposal at this stage of his career or choose to move to pastures new will be interesting to see.

Feature image Julian Finney via Getty Images

The Peoples Person has been one of the world‚Äôs leading Man United news sites for over a decade. bsky.social

title: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a dream‚Äù: Chelsea captain Reece James reflects on momentous 2025 ahead of milestone Aston Villa clash
description: Chelsea captain Reece James has enjoyed a year that felt like a fresh chapter, given his frustrating record with recurring injuries.After taking time to recover and reset earlier in the year, James ha...
fullText:
Chelsea captain Reece James has enjoyed a year that felt like a fresh chapter, given his frustrating record with recurring injuries.

After taking time to recover and reset earlier in the year, James has worked his way back to full fitness and is operating at a level that has restored his status as one of the best players in the world.

The 26-year-old has been one of the most consistent players in the Chelsea squad this year and has put in world-class shifts in key games, notably against Arsenal and Newcastle United.

James‚Äô bounce back from injury has been one for the history books, reminding everyone of his quality and shutting down comparisons that hardly do justice to his brilliance.

He has adapted seamlessly to his midfield transition while being able to slot back into his more natural right-back role without any drop in quality.

James‚Äô availability has helped Chelsea in the ongoing top-four race, and he‚Äôs gearing up to hit a personal milestone when the Blues take on the high-flying Aston Villa at Stamford Bridge this weekend.

Barring any unforeseen setback, the England international will make his 50th appearance of the calendar year against Unai Emery‚Äôs troops.

It will be the first time since 2021 that he has managed to accumulate such a consistent run of games.

James marked his return to Premier League action with a last-gasp free-kick against Bournemouth in January and hasn‚Äôt looked back since.

After featuring in 28 of Chelsea‚Äôs 35 games in all competitions in the second half of last season, he has played in all but one Premier League fixture this term.

He has notched two goals and three assists while creating five big chances in the league, and his consistency helped him cross the 200-game milestone for Chelsea back in October.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a dream for me to play 200 games for the club I‚Äôve supported since I was a little boy,‚Äù James said (via Chelsea‚Äôs official website). ‚ÄúHopefully, I can continue to get many more.‚Äù

title: Marcus Rashford reiterates his desire to join Barcelona next summer
description: On-loan Barcelona forward Marcus Rashford has made it clear that he wants to make his move to Spotify Camp Nou permanent at the end of the season.This isn‚Äôt the first time the Manchester United loan...
fullText:
On-loan Barcelona forward Marcus Rashford has made it clear that he wants to make his move to Spotify Camp Nou permanent at the end of the season.

This isn‚Äôt the first time the Manchester United loanee has been vocal about his long-term future, although Barcelona are still weighing their options.

Rashford has described a permanent move to Barcelona as his ‚Äúultimate goal‚Äù after a strong start to life in Spain.

The 28-year-old joined Barcelona last summer after falling out with Ruben Amorim and slipping down the pecking order at Old Trafford.

Rashford spent the second half of last season on loan at Aston Villa, but his summer move to Barcelona is proving to be a shrewd decision.

The England international has racked up seven goals and 11 assists in 24 games for Barcelona.

He has only managed two goals in 17 La Liga games, although he has only been named in the starting line-up 11 times.

Nevertheless, his tally could be significantly higher if he hadn‚Äôt spurned seven big chances so far.

While his goalscoring tally in the league may be uninspiring, Rashford has made up for it by unlocking his creative abilities.

He has chipped in with eight assists in La Liga, creating four big chances while averaging 1.6 key passes per 90 minutes.

Rashford‚Äôs role at Barcelona has reduced since Raphinha returned from injury, but he has managed to win over the fans by adding fresh goal threat to the club‚Äôs star-studded attacking line-up.

Rashford has always made it clear that Barcelona is his dream destination, and that hasn‚Äôt changed.

The winger, who has previously been hailed as a ‚Äúfantastic‚Äù player by manager Hansi Flick, has once again been clear about his desire to remain at Barcelona.

‚ÄúWhat I want is to stay at Barca,‚Äù Rashford said during an interview with SPORT.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the ultimate goal, but it‚Äôs not the reason I‚Äôm training hard and giving my all. The purpose is to win. Barca is a huge, fantastic club, built to win titles.‚Äù

Rashford‚Äôs loan move to Barcelona includes an optional purchase clause worth ¬£26 million. It remains to be seen if the Blaugranas are willing to keep him beyond this summer.
